comment.author: 37094770@N04
comment._content:
This picture, from the era of glass photographic plates, depicts men who could walk down the street of any business district without standing out.  The man with the upturned collar would attract some notice and the eyeglasses might seem a little eccentric but imagine women dressed in the style of the same era fitting into any modern scene.  

The width of neckties and lapels changes and "European style" clothes are a little more closely tailored but if a man who works where conservative dress is the norm can hold onto his out-of-style things until they rotate back into fashion again.  I can't think of a department store that has more than one floor dedicated to men's clothing.
